long_description:
The words “holiday show” tend to conjure up images of dancing elves, Santa Claus and lavish Christmas trees. But that’s not how the New York Botanical Garden (NYBG) rolls - to them the holiday season means one thing: trains.  

 

Every year since 1992, the Bronx receives thousands of visitors eager to see the newest collection of handmade miniature models of New York City’s most famous buildings. How best to describe what you’ll see in the annual Holiday Train Show? The general consensus is “whimsical,” and we wholeheartedly agree. In a nutshell, this exhibit is comprised of model trains running on tracks built around the Enid A. Haupt Conservatory. Intricate detailed replicas of New York City’s landmarks are placed throughout the display, while vegetation and waterfalls are nestled in the most unexpected nooks.

 

Although generations have been visiting this show every year, no exhibit is every the same - this year, the focus is Midtown Manhattan and some sculptures have been reworked to show-off the mastery of the artists involved - you’ll even see a miniature and fully-working roller coaster and ferris wheel!

 

NYBG Holiday Train Show in Numbers

  • 150 replicas of various NYC landmarks

  • 25 trains

  • Half a mile of tracks

  • 26th year running

  • Built with countless natural materials: seeds, pods, nuts, cones, leaves, etc.

 

Bar Car Nights - Adults Over 21 Only

One can easily spend hours strolling around the exhibit and chances are you’ll eventually need sustenance. Rejoice, for The NYBG has everything from dining, signature drinks and live entertainment during the Bar Car Nights. The cherry on the cake? An outdoor fire pit in the Visitor’s Center and the right to explore the botanical garden with a holiday drink in your hand.

 

More Information About The Holiday Train Show

Location
New York Botanical Garden
2900 Southern Boulevard, Bronx

Hours
The Holiday Show runs from November 22, 2017 to January 15, 2018
Holiday Train Show: 10 am to 6 pm, Tuesday to Sunday
Bar Car Nights: 7:00-10:30 p.m, Tuesday to Sunday
Consult the holiday schedule here.

Tickets
Holiday Train Show: Various ticket options. Consult the NYGB website for full ticket pricing information.
Bar Car Nights: Non-Member $35, NYBG Member $25. Valid ID required. Book tickets in advance because they sell out fast!

How to get there from the Royalton Hotel
Walk a couple of blocks to Grand Central Terminal. Take a train from the Metro-North Harlem line to Botanical Garden Station, cross the road and you’ll be there.

 

If the Holiday Train Show wasn’t enough to get you in a holiday spirit, make the most of the Royalton Hotel’s coveted location and visit Bryant Park’s Winter Village, look at window displays along Fifth Avenue or warm up in front of the fireplace in your room.
